newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian SIDANKO may continue fight for Purneftegaz.
newsitem.headline: Russian SIDANKO may continue fight for Purneftegaz.

text.p: Russia's NK SIDANKO oil company said on Thursday that it might continue its struggle to win control of the Purneftegaz crude oil producer.
"We will continue within the framework of the law to defend our interests," SIDANKO spokesman Konstantin Ilyin said.

SIDANKO (Sibirsko-Dalnevostochnaya Neftyanaya Kompaniya, or the Siberian-Far Eastern Oil Company) this week lost its second court attempt to win Purneftegaz, a key oil producer, from state oil company Rosneft.
A 1994 government resolution gave Purneftegaz to SIDANKO, but a 1995 ruling shifted ownership of the producer to Rosneft.
The changes were part of the government's restructuring of the state-run oil sector into partially privatised, vertically-integrated companies.
